body:
Have not been able to review the change, but one note on the ConcurrentHashMap impl of the cache: we will not want to go with the defaults for concurrency level because CHM defaults to 16-way concurrency and ends up very large in memory to guarantee that. I'm not sure if this is a tunable that should be surfaced in Rails or if we should just pick a reasonable default for how heavily-hit each caching structure will be (e.g. some caches are unlikely to contend, others will be heavily contended).

Definitely will want to look at memory comparisons before/after patch on JRuby.

More to come...going to chat with @tenderlove tomorrow about this. If you can be on IRC tomorrow, @thedarkone, would be good to catch up on this.
